official_title: To amend title 31, United States Code, with respect to the receipt of compensation by executive branch employees for outside speaking, teaching, and writing that relates to official duties, and for other purposes.
short_title: Executive Branch Standards of Conduct Correction Act of 1992

summary.text: Executive Branch Standards of Conduct Correction Act of 1992 - Directs the Director of the Office of Government Ethics (OGE) to amend certain OGE regulations with respect to the prohibition against honoraria. Amends Federal law with respect to the acceptance by executive branch employees of travel and related expenses from non-Federal sources for activities related to official duties.

titles.title: Executive Branch Standards of Conduct Correction Act of 1992

To amend title 31, United States Code, with respect to the receipt of compensation by executive branch employees for outside speaking, teaching, and writing that relates to official duties, and for other purposes.
